t: Help Not in Egypt but in God

Woe*pn to those who go down to Egypt for help And*iln rely on horses, And*ln trust in chariots because they are many And*ln in horsemen because they are very strong, But*ln they do not look to the Holy One of Israel, nor seek the Lord!*s
Yet*ln He also is wise and will bring disaster And*ln does not retract His words, But*ln will arise against the house of evildoers And*ln against the help of the workers of iniquity.

Now*ln the Egyptians are men and not God, And*ln their horses are flesh and not spirit; So*ln the Lord*s will stretch out His hand, And*ln he who helps will stumble And*ln he who is helped will fall, And*ln all of them will come to an end together.

For*ln thus says the Lord*s to me, “As*ln the lion or the young lion growls over his prey, Against*ln which a band of shepherds is called out, And*iln he will not be terrified at their voice nor disturbed at their noise, So*ln will the Lord*s of hosts come down to wage war on Mount Zion and on its hill.”
Like*ln flying birds so the Lord*s of hosts will protect Jerusalem. He*ln will protect and deliver it;*i He*ln will pass over and rescue it.*i
Return*p to Him from whom you have deeply defected, O sons of Israel.
For in that day every man will cast away his silver idols and his gold idols, which your sinful hands have made for you as a sin.
And*pn the Assyrian will fall by a sword not of man, And*ln a sword not of man will devour him. So*ln he will not escape the sword, And*ln his young men will become forced laborers.
“His*ln rock will pass away because of panic, And*ln his princes will be terrified at the standard,” Declares*ln the Lord,*s whose fire is in Zion and whose furnace is in Jerusalem.
